alert.note: Alert for St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 25 at 11:50AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following county, St. Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1144 AM EST, Emergency management reported a developing ice jam on the Raquette River in the town of Pierrepont. Water is rising fast according to emergency management and could impact houses on and near Alexander Drive in the town of Pierrepont. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Potsdam, Colton, Hannawa Falls and South Colton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Ice jams are unpredictable, and rapid fluctuations in water levels are possible. Please obey all road closures and instructions from local authorities. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
